wikipedia_page.main: Sir Roderick Edward Barclay  (2 February 1909 – 24 October 1996) was a British diplomat who was ambassador to Denmark and Belgium.

response: *Sir Roderick Barclay (1909–1996), British Ambassador to Denmark (1956–1960) and to Belgium (1963–1969)

response: * Sir Roderick Barclay (1909–1996), British diplomat, ambassador to Denmark and Belgium
*Roderick Barclay, British diplomat who was ambassador to Denmark and Belgium (b. 1909)

link_mentions.page: Principal Private Secretary to the Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs

response: He married twice.  His first wife was Gillian Birbeck whom he married on 25 May 1905 in Freebridge Lynn, Norfolk.General Register Office. England and Wales Civil Registration Indexes. London, England: General Register Office. © Crown copyright.  She died on 15 May 1909 in Kobe, Japan leaving an infant son Roderick Barclay KCMG (died 1996), who was only three months old, having been born on 22 February previously.

He married Cecil Emily Chetwynd-Talbot in January 1907. They had one daughter, Jean Cecil Gladstone (who married Roderick Barclay), and two sons, John Gladstone of Capenoch (his heir) and David Steaurt Gladstone (an architect).http://www.thepeerage.com/p7768.htm#i77680
*Sir Roderick Barclay, 87, British diplomat and ambassador.
